citation.article-title: Proposal of Parvimonas gen. nov. and Quatrionicoccus gen. nov. as replacements for the illegitimate, prokaryotic, generic names Micromonas Murdoch and Shah 2000 and Quadricoccus Maszenan et al. 2002, respectively.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Quatrionicoccus australiensis (Maszenan et al. 2002) Tindall and Euzéby comb. nov.
Quatrionicoccus australiensis (aus.tra.li.en′sis. N.L. fem. adj. australiensis of Australia, where the isolate originated).
Illegitimate basonym: Quadricoccus australiensis Maszenan et al. 2002.
The description of the species is as given for Quadricoccus australiensis in Maszenan et al. (2002).
